msgSnippet: ... It does not and will not, by design. Please do a Google search for the details. Short version: a test fails if any of its assertions fail; therefore, once
messageBody:
> Hi,
> I am having one testcase say:
>
> testInsert(){
>
> assertTrue();
> - - - - -
> assertEqual();
> - - -
> assertXYZ()
> }
>
> In above case if first assert method i.e. (assertTrue()) fails,
> JUNIT displays failure which is occurred at first assert only & It
> dosent test or checks others assert() Methods. My question is: How
> Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert
> methods fails in a TestCase?

It does not and will not, by design. Please do a Google search for the
details. Short version: a test fails if any of its assertions fail;
therefore, once an assertion fails, there is no reason to continue the test.
It can only fail more.

> Expecting your immediate reply with solution.

You're expecting quite a bit, there. Perhaps a cultural difference, but I
find it impolite to expect someone to hand you an immediate reply with a
solution, so I have handed you an immediately reply with the way to find the
solution.
